results.title: Los Angeles and New York Differ in Their Responses to a Terrorism Threat
results.abstract: After shutting down the nation’s second-largest school system, officials determined that emailed threats of an attack were probably a hoax. New York City officials dismissed a similar threat as such.
results.byline: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and J. DAVID GOODMAN

results.title: Colorado Springs Deals With Mass Killing as Nation Moves On
results.abstract: The shooting at a Planned Parenthood clinic was eclipsed days later by the massacre in San Bernardino, Calif. There are mixed feelings about the loss of attention.

multimedia.caption: A makeshift memorial near the site of a mass shooting at a Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado Springs.

results.title: House Reaches Accord on Spending and Tax Cuts
results.abstract: The package would delay a planned tax on high-cost health insurance plans, suspend a tax on medical devices and expand aid for 9/11 responders.
results.byline: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ROBERT PEAR
des_facet: James Zadroga 9-11 Health and Compensation Act

results.title: Executions by States Fell in 2015, Report Says
results.abstract: New death sentences imposed by courts also declined to levels not seen since the early 1970s, an annual survey found.

results.title: Ex-Washington Mayor Avoids Charges, but Bitterness Lingers
results.abstract: A 57-month inquiry led a dozen people, including some of Vincent C. Gray’s closest supporters, to plead guilty and contributed to his defeat.

multimedia.caption: Former Mayor Vincent C. Gray of Washington, said, “I have always believed that you could count on law enforcement to get to a just conclusion or a just decision. I don’t know where the justice was in this.”

results.title: San Diego Vows to Move Entirely to Renewable Energy in 20 Years
results.abstract: With an ordinance passed on Tuesday, San Diego became the largest American city to make a legally binding commitment to transition to 100 percent renewable energy.

multimedia.caption: Angie Vorhies charged her electric car in San Diego in 2013. The city has committed to using 100 percent renewable energy, becoming the largest American municipality to do so.

results.title: Obama Counters Anti-Muslim Talk by Welcoming New Citizens
results.abstract: The president’s speech at a naturalization ceremony on Tuesday comes as many Republican governors have vowed to bar Syrian refugees from their states.
results.byline: By GARDINER HARRIS and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

results.title: A Mansion, a Shell Company and Resentment in Bel Air
results.abstract: In the booming high-end market of Los Angeles, where hidden ownership is common, one house stands out.

multimedia.caption: The house under construction on Strada Vecchia in Bel Air has been cited for code violations and is the subject of a neighborhood battle. The property is owned by a shell company.

results.title: Oklahoma Highway Shootings Leave 2 Dead
results.abstract: A suspect who the police say fired randomly at cars surrendered to troopers after a short pursuit and, so far, has been charged with driving under the influence.

results.title: Neighbor of San Bernardino Attackers Faces Terrorism Charges
results.abstract: Federal prosecutors say Enrique Marquez, who bought the assault rifles used in the massacre in San Bernardino, Calif., conspired to commit terrorism in 2011 and 2012.
results.byline: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and IAN LOVETT

results.title: Baltimore Wrestles With the Way Forward After a Mistrial
results.abstract: The prosecution hopes to use Officer William G. Porter in the murder trial of Officer Caesar R. Goodson Jr. But after the mistrial, the path ahead is tricky.
results.byline: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

multimedia.caption: Marilyn Mosby, the state’s attorney in Baltimore, on Wednesday. She had vowed to “deliver justice” on behalf of Freddie Gray.

results.title: Chicago Pays Millions but Punishes Few in Killings by Police
results.abstract: The city spent more than $500 million settling police cases since 2004, but a vast majority of complaints against the police still do not result in discipline.
results.byline: By MONICA DAVEY and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS

results.title: Chattanooga Attack Victims to Be Awarded Purple Hearts
results.abstract: Five months after the shooting rampage at two military facilities, five service members who were killed and one survivor will be awarded the medals.

results.title: California Rebukes Rural Prison for Racism
results.abstract: California finds High Desert State Prison to be overcrowded, governed by “oblivious” officials, and run by guards through violence and racism.

results.title: Strike Tests Kohler, Wis., and the Company Sharing Its Name
results.abstract: The announcement that the Kohler Company had offered a contract settlement brought a tentative peace to the village of Kohler, Wis., where the 142-year-old firm was founded.

results.title: San Bernardino Attackers Discussed Jihad in Private Messages, F.B.I. Says
results.abstract: James B. Comey, the bureau director, said that Tashfeen Malik and Syed Rizwan Farook used private online messages to communicate their commitment to Islamic extremists, not social media.
results.byline: By AL BAKER and MARC SANTORA
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

results.title: Los Angeles Schools Reopen With Many Parents on Edge
results.abstract: Even though the threat from the previous day had been deemed a hoax, many parents were wary of sending their children back to class.
results.byline: By IAN LOVETT and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

results.title: Ferguson Nears Deal With Justice Dept. to Overhaul Police Force

results.abstract: The trial was seen as a barometer of whether it was possible to convict a police officer, but does not end the tension in Baltimore surrounding Mr. Gray’s death.

results.title: Report Finds Less Misuse of Painkillers by Teenagers
results.abstract: The news heartened officials who remained concerned at the steady numbers regarding marijuana and e-cigarette use.

results.title: Tennessee Woman Tried Coat-Hanger Abortion, Police Say
results.abstract: The Murfreesboro woman was charged with attempted murder after the police said she tried to abort her 24-week-old fetus.

results.title: Ted Cruz, Shunned in the Senate, Plays Unpopularity to His Advantage
results.abstract: Ted Cruz has managed to alienate and agitate most of his Republican colleagues, but he has used his role as an outsider as a source of strength in his presidential campaign.

results.title: A Guide to the N.C.I.S. Investigative Report
results.abstract: A review of the documents provides vivid details of the detainee abuse reported at a military outpost at Kalach, Afghanistan.

des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces
